subject: Re: [junit] writing testcase for data read from a file
msgSnippet: ... I think that there is more happening that just reading from a file. This is already implemented with java.io.FileInputStream. If you initialize an instance
messageBody:
On Mon, 23 Sep 2002 04:33:25 -0700 (PDT), Singh Manpreet wrote:

>This is a sort of newbie question, could anyone please
>explain me how i can write a testcase for a method
>which is reading data from a file.

I think that there is more happening that just reading
from a file. This is already implemented with
java.io.FileInputStream.

If you initialize an instance with values read from
a file, you should write a test, that tests the following
things:

Handling of different errors occuring when reading from a
file:

- File does not exist
- File can't be read
- File is a directory

Handling of invalid data

- Empty file
- Incorrect values in file

And of course:

- Test the correct initialization if all values are correct
in the file

More I can't guess from you original mail.


Regards, Lothar

--
Lothar Kimmeringer E-Mail: lothar@...
PGP-encrypted mails preferred (Key-ID: 0x8BC3CD81)

Always remember: The answer is forty-two, there can only be wrong
questions!
